channel.title: A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content on A Hugo website

item.title: Study on Canadian Federal Election 2019
item.description: Abstract This is a report about the data analysis on the 2019 Canadian Federal Election internet survey trying to see if it is possible to explain people’s political interest by the information gathered from the survey. Introduction Can we forecast Federal Election’s outcome, people’s favorite Party using voters personal information as variable? It seems no one has a definite answer on whether the election result is predictable, but it was stated by many scientists that there are correlations between voters’ factors and the candidate that he/she votes for.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.
